conclusion: Solve step by step to find when particles A and B are farthest apart.
Both particles start at the same position (O), moving in the same direction.
Particle A accelerates from 0 to 2v₀ during time 0 to t₀.
Particle A maintains 2v₀ velocity from t₀ to 2t₀.
Particle A decelerates from 2v₀ to 0 during time 2t₀ to 3t₀.
Particle A remains at rest after 3t₀.
Particle B accelerates from 0 to v₀ during time 0 to 3t₀.
Particle B maintains v₀ velocity from 3t₀ to 5t₀.
Particle B decelerates from v₀ to 0 during time 5t₀ to 6t₀.
Displacement is the area under the velocity-time curve.
At t = t₀, x_A(t₀) = v₀t₀.
At t = 2t₀, x_A(2t₀) = 3v₀t₀.
At t = 3t₀, x_A(3t₀) = 4v₀t₀.
For t ≥ 3t₀, x_A(t) = 4v₀t₀ (constant).
At t = 3t₀, x_B(3t₀) = 1.5v₀t₀.
At t = 5t₀, x_B(5t₀) = 3.5v₀t₀.
At t = 6t₀, x_B(6t₀) = 4v₀t₀.
At t = t₀, separation = 5v₀t₀/6.
At t = 2t₀, separation = 7v₀t₀/3.
At t = 3t₀, separation = 2.5v₀t₀.
